mods.abstract: A pamphlet published in conjunction with the 1983 initiative to prevent teen pregnancy and to alleviate the range of problems facing adolescent and female-headed households.

location.physicalLocation: Langston Hughes Library (Children's Defense Fund Haley Farm)

titleInfo.title: The Lessons of the Multi-Site Initiatives Serving High-Risk Youths

mods.abstract: This report gives summary information on the multi-site initiatives addressing teenage pregnancy or issues affecting low-income and minority youths. Its focus is on what can be learned from these initiatives as they grapple with the twin goals of success and replicability. It also presents information about replicating program models and about assisting communities and institutions assess, plan, and implement changes that will improve outcomes for high-risk youths.

location.physicalLocation: Langston Hughes Library (Children's Defense Fund Haley Farm)

mods.abstract: This report examines the needs of young adolescents and evaluates the quality of schools' responses, focusing on specific schools that have implemented effective programs. Findings of the Children's Defense Fund's survey of state policies at the middle-grades level also are included. Finally, this report recommends measures that the federal government and the states can take to help schools meet their critical mission.

location.physicalLocation: Langston Hughes Library (Children's Defense Fund Haley Farm)

titleInfo.title: Adolescent Pregnancy: An Anatomy of a Social Problem in Search of Comprehensive Solutions

mods.abstract: This report is adapted from a Grenville Clark lecture by CDF President Marian Wright Edelman at Dartmouth College. It addresses problem of adolescent pregnancy, identifies some of the major barriers that get in the way of solutions, outlines what needs to be done by whom, and describes strategies CDF is pursuing to stem premature sexual activity and pregnancy.

location.physicalLocation: Langston Hughes Library (Children's Defense Fund Haley Farm)

titleInfo.title: Adolescent Pregnancy: Whose Problem Is It?

mods.abstract: This report is the second in a series of reports on adolescent pregnancy prevention that addresses the need to strengthen family and communities and bolster self-sufficiency.

location.physicalLocation: Langston Hughes Library (Children's Defense Fund Haley Farm)

titleInfo.title: Adolescent Pregnancy: What the States Are Saying

mods.abstract: This report is the third in a series of reports on adolescent pregnancy prevention. It is intended as a reference tool for those who want to begin to answer the question: what can states do to help prevent teen pregnancy?

location.physicalLocation: Langston Hughes Library (Children's Defense Fund Haley Farm)

titleInfo.title: Preventing Adolescent Pregnancy: What Schools Can Do

mods.abstract: This report reviews schools' efforts to delay pregnancy through family life and sexuality education and through development of youths' life options.

location.physicalLocation: Langston Hughes Library (Children's Defense Fund Haley Farm)

titleInfo.title: Latino Child Poverty in the United States

mods.abstract: This report addresses the issue of childhood poverty in Latino families and seeks to provide data that America must solve this problem to help the America's future workforce.

location.physicalLocation: Langston Hughes Library (Children's Defense Fund Haley Farm)

titleInfo.title: Facing the Facts: A Progress Report on Ohio's Black Children

mods.abstract: This report provides information and data on the status of black children in Ohio. It offers recommendations for public policy and private action on behalf of Ohio's black children and families.

location.physicalLocation: Langston Hughes Library (Children's Defense Fund Haley Farm)

titleInfo.title: Poverty Matters: The Cost of Child Poverty in America

mods.abstract: This report presents statistical data to document the economic and social effects of childhood poverty.

location.physicalLocation: Langston Hughes Library (Children's Defense Fund Haley Farm)

titleInfo.title: All Over the Map: A Progress Report on the State Children's Health Insurance Program (CHIP)

mods.abstract: This study looks at the impact of the State Children's Health Insurance Program (CHIP) and suggests ways for states to successfully provide healthcare coverage for children.

location.physicalLocation: Langston Hughes Library (Children's Defense Fund Haley Farm)

mods.abstract: This seventh edition of The Health of America's Children presents national, international, state, and city statistics on the health of America's children and the adequacy of programs that serve them. It lobbies to invest in prevention rather than paying for the effects later.

location.physicalLocation: Langston Hughes Library (Children's Defense Fund Haley Farm)

titleInfo.title: Doctors and Dollars Are Not Enough: How to Improve Health Services for Children and their Families

mods.abstract: This book is devoted to how CDF and the government can provide primary health care services to all children and their families. It describes the elements of good health care programs.

location.physicalLocation: Langston Hughes Library (Children's Defense Fund Haley Farm)

mods.abstract: This report provides statistical data to establish the great unmet needs of America's poor children, including access to healthcare, public assistance, and effect of unemployment of the family.

location.physicalLocation: Langston Hughes Library (Children's Defense Fund Haley Farm)

titleInfo.title: EPSDT: Does It Spell Health Care for Poor Children?

mods.abstract: This book is devoted to how agencies can provide primary health care services to all children and their families. It describes the elements of good health care programs and evaluates EPSDT to determine if this preventive and primary health care program measures up to CDF's standards.

name.namePart: Early and Periodic Screening, Diagnosis, and Treatment Program (U.S.)

location.physicalLocation: Langston Hughes Library (Children's Defense Fund Haley Farm)

titleInfo.title: Improving Health Programs for Low-Income Youths

mods.abstract: This report updates and expands guidance on adolescent health for state Medicaid Early and Periodic Screening, Diagnosis, and Treatment (EPSDT) programs developed by federal officials in the 1980s. It aims to help policy makers, public health administrators, and community leaders understand legislative changes and their relationship to creating better health programs.

location.physicalLocation: Langston Hughes Library (Children's Defense Fund Haley Farm)

titleInfo.title: Adolescent And Young Adult Fathers: Problems And Solutions

mods.abstract: This report addresses the financial responsibilities of adolescent and young adult fathers and ways to encourage financial responsibility in young fathers; statistcal data provides insight into the profile of the unwed adolescent father and explores ideas for programs and solutions to assist young fathers in providing financial resources for their children.

location.physicalLocation: Langston Hughes Library (Children's Defense Fund Haley Farm)

titleInfo.title: Teenage Pregnancy: An Advocate's Guide To The Numbers

mods.abstract: This report presents numerical analysis of answers to such questions as: "What proportion of teens get pregnant each year, have babies each year, and get abortions each year? Other numerical analysis explores the likelihood of use of contraceptives by black teens and white teens and what proportion of out-of-wedlock births are to teens. Commomly confused statistical data terms, such as 'out-of-wedlock,' 'pregnancy rates,' 'birth rates,' 'annual rates,' and 'cohort rates' are explained.

location.physicalLocation: Langston Hughes Library (Children's Defense Fund Haley Farm)

titleInfo.title: Opportunities For Prevention: Building After-School And Summer Programs For Young Adolescents

mods.abstract: This report examines the important role that well-designed community programs can play in meeting the academic, pre-vocational, physical, social and emotional needs of 10-15 year olds in the after school, vacation, and summer hours. The report explores how these programs can aid in not only the prevention of adolescent pregnancy but can and should provide opportunities for the development of prerequisite skills, experiences, and opportunities that enable teens to become economically self-sufficient adults.

location.physicalLocation: Langston Hughes Library (Children's Defense Fund Haley Farm)

mods.abstract: This report focuses on ways to increase and improve paternity establishment and other child support enforcement services for children born to teen mothers.

location.physicalLocation: Langston Hughes Library (Children's Defense Fund Haley Farm)

titleInfo.title: Model Programs: Preventing Adolescent Pregnancy And Building Youth Self-Sufficiency

mods.abstract: This report describes a number of first-rate programs and curricula that address adolescents' need for preventing teen pregnancy and building youth self-sufficiency. The report explores how decisions about sexual activity and contraception for those who are sexually active are tied closely to teens' feelings of self esteem, aspirations, and perceptions of opportunity.

location.physicalLocation: Langston Hughes Library (Children's Defense Fund Haley Farm)

titleInfo.title: Declining Earnings Of Young Men: Their Relation To Poverty, Teen Pregnancy, And Family Formation

mods.abstract: This report focuses primarily on the earnings and marriage rates of young men and how those earning losses of young males is directly linked to the problem of adolescent pregnancy and the declines in black family formation. The report also explores how earning potential is directly related to basic skills achievement, education level, and poverty.

location.physicalLocation: Langston Hughes Library (Children's Defense Fund Haley Farm)

titleInfo.title: Evaluating Your Adolescent Pregnancy Program: How To Get Started

mods.abstract: This report focuses on how evaluation of teen pregnancy programs is needed and required and how the costs associated with evaluation of these programs can be handled to ensure that funding for the programs is maintained as a high priority in communities.

location.physicalLocation: Langston Hughes Library (Children's Defense Fund Haley Farm)

titleInfo.title: Teens and AIDS: Opportunities for Prevention

mods.abstract: By September 1988, almost 1,500 children younger than 20 had been diagnosed with AIDS. Half of them are now dead. To prevent infection, high-risk behavior must be stopped.

location.physicalLocation: Langston Hughes Library (Children's Defense Fund Haley Farm)

mods.abstract: This book gives facts on the conditions of African American children in America

titleInfo.title: Making a Difference in Children's Lives

mods.abstract: The Children's Defense Fund, a non-profit organization, created a summer enrichment program in Marlboro County [South Carolina] bringing together community resources, college students, educational experts, federal feeding programs and 600 children. This film shows the work that was done in South Carolina but the Fund is a "national organization with roots in communites across America" which coordinates the Black Community Crusade for Children, of which the Freedom Schools are a service arm

mods.abstract: This report explores the fastest growing youth population in the country, Latino youth. location.physicalLocation: Langston Hughes Library (Children's Defense Fund Haley Farm)

titleInfo.title: Where To Find Data About Adolescents and Young Adults: A Guide to Sources

mods.abstract: This report is meant to be a research guide and a reference tool to help children's advocates locate some of the facts, especially the statistical data, as it relates to adolescents and young adults. Local and national data is presented in the report. Examples of data presented include family and marital status, living arrangements, census data, income and poverty, employment, health, nutrition, and mental health.

location.physicalLocation: Langston Hughes Library (Children's Defense Fund Haley Farm)

titleInfo.title: An Advocate's Guide to Improving Education

mods.abstract: This report focuses on where the nation stands in the educational goals for its children and the National Education Goals that should be in place by the year 2000. The report elaborates on each goal and what measures are needed to attain each goal.

location.physicalLocation: Langston Hughes Library (Children's Defense Fund Haley Farm)

titleInfo.title: The Grandparent's and Other Relative Caregiver's Guide to Child Care and Early Childhood Education Programs

mods.abstract: A guide to finding and paying for child care and early childhood education programs for relatives raising young children.

location.physicalLocation: Langston Hughes Library (Children's Defense Fund Haley Farm)

titleInfo.title: Child Care: An Essential Service for Teen Parents

mods.abstract: In this report we focus on child care for the children of teen mothers, and the emerging response of schools, social service agencies, cities, and states to that need. Not nearly enough is being done, but the growing activity in the area holds promise. This report reviews the criteria for good programs, the barriers to creating them, some model programs, and some different state initiatives.

location.physicalLocation: Langston Hughes Library (Children's Defense Fund Haley Farm)

titleInfo.title: Children Out of School In America

mods.abstract: A survey of households, school officials, and community leaders concerning children 7 to 17 years of age in the United States who are not in enrolled in school.

mods.abstract: A report designed to help state policy makers and community leaders identify new ways to meet the employment and training needs of youths within their state.

location.physicalLocation: Langston Hughes Library (Children's Defense Fund Haley Farm)

mods.abstract: This report provides an overview of the emerging youth service movement, focusing on some of the organizations and model programs that have reinforced and built upon the foundation of service in traditional civic, youth, and religious organizations. These new creative programs hope to tap a vast reservoir of youth talent and energy, channeling them into service activities to meet the nation's needs.

location.physicalLocation: Langston Hughes Library (Children's Defense Fund Haley Farm)

mods.abstract: This report describes the various youth corps programs in existence and how these youth corps programs help address the needs of today's youth by stressing discipline and structure, reinforcement of basic skills, and how the corps provide dependable labor for community improvement projects.

location.physicalLocation: Langston Hughes Library (Children's Defense Fund Haley Farm)

mods.abstract: This report examines the direct relationship between youth employment, or lack thereof, to teen pregnancy, and how communities in providing opportunities for employment of youth, can help eleviate other issues, such as teen pregnancy and juvenile delinquency.

location.physicalLocation: Langston Hughes Library (Children's Defense Fund Haley Farm)

location.physicalLocation: Langston Hughes Library (Children's Defense Fund Haley Farm)

titleInfo.title: Haley Farm Homecoming Speeches: Our Children's Present and Future: Non-Market Values

mods.abstract: America's youth are growing up in a society that places increasing value on market forces and mentalities. Dr. Cornel West addresses the social costs when non-market values--love, care, trust, etc. are pushed to the edge of our culture.

location.physicalLocation: Langston Hughes Library (Children's Defense Fund Haley Farm)
Langston Hughes Library (Children's Defense Fund Haley Farm)

titleInfo.title: Rekindling the Spirit: A Vision for the New Millennial Movement to Leave No Child Behind

mods.abstract: An account of the gathering of the Children's Defense Fund and the Black Community Crusade For Children at the former Alex Haley Farm in December 1997 to examine problems facing social reformers.

location.physicalLocation: Langston Hughes Library (Children's Defense Fund Haley Farm)
